ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This course had really well structured assignments that built up to the final research paper. It was the best preparation I could have had for a senior thesis in history.

Through this course, I was exposed to the methodology for analyzing gender in history. I also learned about the ways that people in various parts of Latin America across centuries used the court system, witnesses, petitions, protests, and rebellions to fight against oppression. The readings for the class discussed a wide range of topics, including pre-colonial and early colonial Mexico, plantation slavery, the post-independence period, and 20th century cold war history. Through my final research paper, I was able to study an area of particular interest to me in more depth.

This course really gave the perspective on how to analyze readings and have discussions like a historians. The way in which we analyze the weekly readings allow me to have a deeper perspective on gender in latin america and the Caribbean.
I learned a lot especially about the colonial period in Latin America and the way gender played a role in the development of identities and shaping of history.
Read about gender and state across many Latin American countries, looked at various texts in a diverse syllabus .

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course was really well structured around course themes and all the assignments emphasized engaging with readings' arguments about gender and sexuality rather than just the facts of the topic covered in that week's book.

This was a fantastic course and one of the best that I have taken at Yale! Professor Eller is one of my all-time favorite professors that I have had at Yale, and all of our class discussions are very interesting and engaging. We spend each week focusing on a particular text in-depth, so we get to engage in nuanced discussions about different historical analyses. We also learn about a wide range of locations and time periods, so there are many options for our final paper. There are no major weaknesses for this course. The one thing to keep in mind is that the weekly writing responses can take a while to complete, but the substitution options are helpful and the workload was manageable.

The structure of the class is amazing and while it might be a lot of readings, you only have the class once a week so if you spread out the readings then you should be good. Prof Eller is also amazing and makes the class such a comfortable environment.
Very organized, Eller is incredible, and the course is conducive to you engaging with the material in a way that matters to you.

Strengths: supportive classroom environment, and seminar setting, encouraged participation and enjoyable learning setting, papers were amazing. Weakness: wouldve appreciated clearer feedback on grows for papers

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes; any course with Professor Eller is like master class in the methodology for history research and writing.

I would definitely recommend this class to another student, especially if they are interested in Latin American history! It was one of my favorite classes that I have taken at Yale. All of the readings and discussions were very fascinating and engaging.

I would completely recommend this course. The structure of the class is amazing and while it might be a lot of readings, you only have the class once a week so if you spread out the readings then you should be good. Prof Eller is also amazing and makes the class such a comfortable environment. I also appreciate the content in the class, especially with the focus in the caribbean and countries in latin america that are often not discussed about. The workload is also very manageable.
Absolutely!! Amazing experience overall, and professor was so kind and welcoming .
